sections.title: Page 1
sections.content: Complaint Management IM_QM_002 1 Instruction for Business Process Release: Supplier Complaint Management System: SAP ECC 6.0 Module: Quality Management Document No. : IM_QM_001 Title: Complaint Management Subtitle: Business Process Created by : Vivek Sharma Date : 26.12.2011 Last Updated by : Vivek Sharma Date of change : 27.04.2012

sections.title: Page 3
sections.content: Complaint Management IM_QM_002 3 1 Background In IEE SAP system, Quality notifications would be u sed to manage the existing complaint man- agement system. Currently IEE follow following thre e business processes. 1. Customer Complaint Management System 2. Supplier Complaint Management System 3. Internal Complaint Management System Quality notifications would help IEE in managing th eir complaint management system from initi- ating the complaints to finally closing the complai nts with complete analysis and reporting which would be further used for communicating with both i nternal and external customer and suppliers. This document highlights the various steps involved in completing a Supplier Complaint in SAP successfully so that the subsequent reporting syste ms can be used. 2 Supplier Complaint Management 2.1 QM01: Create Supplier Complaint Initial Screen once QM01 transaction is entered.

sections.title: Page 4
sections.content: Complaint Management IM_QM_002 4 Selection of Appropriate Notification Type: Z2 Initial Screen once QM01 transaction is entered. Initial Screen once QM01 transaction is entered.

sections.title: Page 5
sections.content: Complaint Management IM_QM_002 5 Reference Object - First TAB of Notification Transaction i.e. QM01 Maintain the following Details: 1. Material Details 2. Plant details 3. Reference Number 4. Reference Notification Subject-Second TAB of Notification Transaction i.e. QM01 1. Short Description of the Complaint. 2. Detailed Description of the Complaint

sections.title: Page 6
sections.content: Complaint Management IM_QM_002 6 Processing Data - Third TAB of Notification Transaction i.e. QM01 1. Partner Functions: i. Department Partner Function ii. Author Partner Function iii. Person Responsible Partner iv. Vendor Partner Function Function This is the TAB for the Complaint Data. In the Overview TAB folllowing information is maintained. i. Defect Types This is the predeined list of Defect Types in IEE. This data can be updated through system configuration.

sections.title: Page 7
sections.content: Complaint Management IM_QM_002 7 Overview Data View Long Text is maintained for the selected Defect Type.This data reflects in the supplier complaint report Long Text Details This is the SUBTAB screen for Root Cause.

sections.title: Page 8
sections.content: Complaint Management IM_QM_002 8 SUBTAB screen for Rootcaus e data This is the TAB for the Complaint Data. In the Root Cause TAB folllowing information is maintained.

sections.title: Page 9
sections.content: Complaint Management IM_QM_002 9 On saving the transaction Notification is created for Supplier Process.

sections.title: Page 13
sections.content: Complaint Management IM_QM_002 13 3 Supplier Complaint Management: Status Definitions 3.2 Complaint Management: Status Status in Complaint management would be independent of the Respective Complaint Process and would have the same interpretation across the relea se. Following is the definition of various statuses which would in usage. 1. OSNO: Outstanding notification 2. NOTE: Notification (external) 3. NOPR: Notification in process 4. OSTS: Outstanding task(s) exist(s) 5. NOCO: Notification Completed 6. ATCO: All Tasks Completed 7. TSOS: Task Outstanding 8. NOTI: Notification (internal) 9. TSRL: Task Released 10. TSCO: Task Completed 11. TSSC: Task Successful
